page.title: 05ST. MARY'S CHURCH GARFORTH
page.content: {St. Mary's}stands on{Church Lane} and was built in{l876}in the shape of a cross. As you go through the main entrance you see a small cupboard in which all the different service books are kept. The{font}which is a sand- stone bowl, is used for baptism water at{christenings.}It is stood on a gravestone and has a wooden lid. Behind the font is a{choir vestry} where the choir get changed. The choir sing hymns in the services. The all wear blue robes. The{pews}where people sit are in long rows with aisles at the side and down the middle. In front of the pews is a lectern in the shape of an eagle. The main{altar}is where weddings and blessings are held. The{Lady Chapel,}at the side of the{ {pulpit,}has an alter and another font.
